item.title: Getting Hard Disk Info in Mac Using Terminal
item.description:
Its pretty easy. Just run the diskutil like the following

Command

diskutil info disk0

Output

   Device Identifier:         disk0
   Device Node:               /dev/disk0
   Whole:                     Yes
   Part of Whole:             disk0
   Device / Media Name:       APPLE SSD AP0256M

   Volume Name:               Not applicable (no file system)
   Mounted:                   Not applicable (no file system)
   File System:               None

   Content (IOContent):       GUID_partition_scheme
   OS Can Be Installed:       No
   Media Type:                Generic
   Protocol:                  PCI-Express
   SMART Status:              Verified

   Disk Size:                 251.0 GB (251000193024 Bytes) (exactly 490234752 512-Byte-Units)
   Device Block Size:         4096 Bytes

   Media OS Use Only:         No
   Media Read-Only:           No
   Volume Read-Only:          Not applicable (no file system)

   Device Location:           Internal
   Removable Media:           Fixed

   Solid State:               Yes
   Virtual:                   No

item.title: Backup and restore all your apps in Mac OS
item.description:
Prerequisite

This assumes you are installing everything using homebrew as a practice. If you are not doing it already, getting started is as easy as it gets. Some

Search for an app(cli/gui)

brew search <<app>>

To install a cli app

brew install <<cli app>>

To install a GUI app

brew install --cask <<gui app>>

Backup all your apps (cli and gui)

brew bundle dump

This will output a file called Brewfile whose contents will look like the following
